commit_message:
Add support for coordination parameters

Since [1] was merged, Sahara supports distributed periodic tasks which
relies on coordination implemented in the tooz library. This change
introduces support for the parameters to enable distributed task
executions.

[1] 6610c256dc3f01eb91e19ff57e9986113f2a04e6

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/792535
Change-Id: I217c4a0fb3cd0cb1af51dcfe9b174046684aa0fc

commit_message:
Enable QoS min bw tempest in neutron-ovs-tempest-multinode-full

After I13fd2dc023b806ac74ab5c8d86cc99f807f0f702 the base job
tempest-multinode-full-py3 does not have the MinBwAllocationPlacementTest
tempest tests enabled by default. So enable it in
neutron-ovs-tempest-multinode-full not to lose any test covereage

Change-Id: I6967b55e8ce8d422422e943818145b718cd10f02

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 08:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f

commit_message:
Enable Ceph RGW public port into firewall when using SSL

Adds CephRgwPublic endpoint port to firewall rule because it does
not match the CephRgwInternal endpoint port when using SSL

In train/ussuri/victoria we do not need the cephadm fix because it wasn't supported then.

Change-Id: Ia08b3d9b0fc96511e5a9202fa5e5a09487263e5b
(cherry picked from commit c69733bb652fa4bb546cd1dbf4cd40a4f157467d)
Closes-Bug: 1942198
(cherry picked from commit e3073243bd6c6bc61f3a805d6e3f028f6ea8ce6d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-06 14:08:13.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: Rename prefixed parameter definitions

We're going to be removing these prefixes in the near term future, which
will require adding 'max_version' to some of them. Get ahead of that by
separating these out.

As an aside, the idea of a global parameters.yaml file seems to have
been a bad one. The duplication it saves is almost negligible and it's a
PITA to modify. One to fix later.

Change-Id: I193b7ee09aa0d8f0ef29292ecec72c12de8679e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-08-19 11:10:41.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: Rename prefixed parameter definitions

We're going to be removing these prefixes in the near term future, which
will require adding 'max_version' to some of them. Get ahead of that by
separating these out.

As an aside, the idea of a global parameters.yaml file seems to have
been a bad one. The duplication it saves is almost negligible and it's a
PITA to modify. One to fix later.

Change-Id: I193b7ee09aa0d8f0ef29292ecec72c12de8679e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Rename prefixed parameter definitions

We're going to be removing these prefixes in the near term future, which
will require adding 'max_version' to some of them. Get ahead of that by
separating these out.

As an aside, the idea of a global parameters.yaml file seems to have
been a bad one. The duplication it saves is almost negligible and it's a
PITA to modify. One to fix later.

Change-Id: I193b7ee09aa0d8f0ef29292ecec72c12de8679e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
api: Drop extension prefixes and legacy fields

Add microversion 2.90, which drops a variety of extension prefixes and
some legacy fields from various servers and flavors responses.

Change-Id: Id45e60854e90995a7c796e3b654df74384389a9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Blueprint: remove-extension-prefixes

commit_message:
Release python-brick-cinderclient-ext 1.4.0

This is the Xena release of the brick cinderclient extension.
Also cut the stable/xena branch.

commit_message:
Update the LoadBalancers Reconciliation Loop

The patch handles the KuryrLoadBalancers reconcilation
using periodic task as event scheduler instead of eventlet

Implements: blueprint reconcile-openstack-resources-with-k8s
Change-Id: I85d2d1cf00b2543f41a875b32ae64fbbe885652c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 08:32:31.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)

commit_message:
use payloads for ROUTER_INTERFACE events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for ROUTER_INTERFACE events for those that are not using them yet.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639814/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Change-Id: I332e9745b57a22f0ca9338b52dab69c53ff59fcc

commit_message:
ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)

commit_message:
ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)

commit_message:
Fix getting service_name

Module parameters are passed as 'None' when not provided
and does not have a default. It works for other params
as there are defaults.

Change-Id: I694082fbdd1ace26628469b086556d2528bea458
(cherry picked from commit de8bfa8048a6005ea5af6f61d735edca5021e3eb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:10:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py
      neutron/scheduler/base_resource_filter.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432
(cherry picked from commit 668b1cc652f076e555ef1fc1289684367159186a)
(cherry picked from commit 816aca60b90b89038863d6974b5a9e0ee8983424)
(cherry picked from commit 1eb6b8926a7a5ad442c5af6057c042999e2645f1)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py
      neutron/scheduler/base_resource_filter.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432
(cherry picked from commit 668b1cc652f076e555ef1fc1289684367159186a)
(cherry picked from commit 816aca60b90b89038863d6974b5a9e0ee8983424)
(cherry picked from commit 1eb6b8926a7a5ad442c5af6057c042999e2645f1)

commit_message:
Fix up client init

Commit c9114b7eb82620db8d4bee7ce660e9d03670fd2d introduced a critical
bug where service_type is not being passed through to the client making
it fail.

Change-Id: I6c19199785109cacef6d8b06e08d926efc6d4890
Closes-Bug: #1942330

[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:05:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:

  "load" value is bumped.

commit_message:
Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432
(cherry picked from commit 668b1cc652f076e555ef1fc1289684367159186a)

commit_message:
Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb

commit_message:
Retire puppet-monasca

This module still depends on outdated interface of puppet-python which
was already removed. Because we haven't seen any intention to keep it
maintained[1], I'd propose retiring the module now.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-August/024118.html

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/805103/
Change-Id: Ib99cda66f99caeb1e6affd198c589de1124ccd29

[{'created': '2021-09-02 15:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'mariadb: support 10.5 in security_reset

CentOS 9 ships mariadb 10.5, and mysql_secure_installation
outputs slightly different initial questions on a stock
mariadb db install. Tweak the expect script to parse
this output while keeping support for the older versions.

Change-Id: Idcd83db52947821fbbd541187d178f6c6f456493
'}]
commit_message:
mariadb: support 10.5 in security_reset

CentOS 9 ships mariadb 10.5, and mysql_secure_installation
outputs slightly different initial questions on a stock
mariadb db install. Tweak the expect script to parse
this output while keeping support for the older versions.

Change-Id: Idcd83db52947821fbbd541187d178f6c6f456493

commit_message:
tests: Add missing 'nova update' unit tests

We have functional tests for the 'nova update' commands, but no unit
tests to verify e.g. that we can't set a description for the server
before microversion 2.19. Add such tests.

Change-Id: I9af89655a7e7276446a881fd28d21ddd6581048c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

fencing agent, where CNV virtual machines acting as cluster nodes:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/fence-agents/pull/412

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-12 05:27:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9
(cherry picked from commit f10842848b03aa652a50d04ce4732356300736f4)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9
(cherry picked from commit f10842848b03aa652a50d04ce4732356300736f4)

commit_message:
Add cleanup_source_server to share server migration start

Introduces a new option called `cleanup-source-server` to the share
server migration start command.

With this optional parameter, administrators are able to specify
to manila if the source share server should be deleted right after
the migration is completed.

Depends-On: I48bafd92fe7a4d4ae0bafd5bf1961dace56b6005
Change-Id: I59db0596e46d9506c7356478241c0505b1b9ec39

commit_message:
Extend fencing to hosts using fence_kubevirt agent.

This commit extends the fencing class allowing operators to use
fence_kubevirt for nodes running on kubevirt / CNV.

commit_message:
Fail validation if pacemaker service is not active

Pacemaker-status validation always reports success regardless
of the actual status of the service.

Add a task to fail validation when pacemaker service is found
inactive/failed

Closes-Bug: #1940519

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8d99321c870aee70f0e177b1b633654a04c8402
(cherry picked from commit 2a7c43df4ae997d66f1fd9cf2e4e5acf32646e7b)

commit_message:
Fail validation if pacemaker service is not active

Pacemaker-status validation always reports success regardless
of the actual status of the service.

Add a task to fail validation when pacemaker service is found
inactive/failed

Closes-Bug: #1940519

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8d99321c870aee70f0e177b1b633654a04c8402
(cherry picked from commit 2a7c43df4ae997d66f1fd9cf2e4e5acf32646e7b)

commit_message:
Do not test detail of keystone::auth::service_identity

... but test interfaces of that resource type. This helps us avoid
direct breakage caused by any change in puppet-keystone.

Change-Id: Ibb82de966c2fae111da43b613c38a1cb0e2dfa8c

commit_message:
Fail validation if pacemaker service is not active

Pacemaker-status validation always reports success regardless
of the actual status of the service.

Add a task to fail validation when pacemaker service is found
inactive/failed

Closes-Bug: #1940519

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8d99321c870aee70f0e177b1b633654a04c8402
(cherry picked from commit 2a7c43df4ae997d66f1fd9cf2e4e5acf32646e7b)

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2021-09-02 11:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 11:58:48.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Iceaa69d80eef75db5bac67463a59fd615ae0e895
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Iceaa69d80eef75db5bac67463a59fd615ae0e895

[{'created': '2021-08-31 13:45:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

Passing newline to the dnsmasq may cause security issues, especially
that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

"}, {'created': '2021-08-31 13:47:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

Passing newline to the dnsmasq may cause security issues, especially
that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

Closes-Bug: #1939733
Change-Id: Ifeaf258f0b5ea86f25620ac4116d618980a7272e
(cherry picked from commit df891f0593d234e01f27d7c0376d9702e178ecfb)

- pure-devstack-manila-tempest-aio http://openstack-logs.purestorage.com/02/789702/4/thirdparty-check/pure-devstack-manila-tempest-aio/c425c9e/ : FAILURE in 1h 10m 06s
- pure-devstack-manila-tempest-fa-aio http://openstack-logs.purestorage.com/02/789702/4/thirdparty-check/pure-devstack-manila-tempest-fa-aio/8e9a568/ : FAILURE in 58m 07s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-09-02 07:24:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This is extremely strange, and I want to continue to investigate - i saw similar messages in the dummy driver logs last time, but now I don't see them in that driver jobs' scheduler/share logs - rather, here's a brief occurrence in the ceph-nfs driver job:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/481d32781b754da0988a1c958a7bbeb4/log/controller/logs/screen-m-shr.txt?severity=3#7807-8593

Aug 31 21:30:25.432952 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-share[119350]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-b0d9cfc7-54d8-4db6-8216-693cb989f220 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 10.06 sec
Aug 31 21:37:30.869615 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-share[119350]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-b0d9cfc7-54d8-4db6-8216-693cb989f220 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 5.30 sec
Aug 31 21:38:04.412841 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-share[119350]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-b0d9cfc7-54d8-4db6-8216-693cb989f220 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 3.54 sec
Aug 31 21:39:31.861919 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-share[119350]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-b0d9cfc7-54d8-4db6-8216-693cb989f220 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 7.43 sec
Aug 31 21:40:58.466025 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-share[119350]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-b0d9cfc7-54d8-4db6-8216-693cb989f220 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 6.57 sec


https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/481d32781b754da0988a1c958a7bbeb4/log/controller/logs/screen-m-sch.txt?severity=3

Aug 31 21:37:30.867153 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-scheduler[119378]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-f4e96796-0735-453a-bc0a-628b6201f280 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 5.31 sec
Aug 31 21:38:04.385570 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-scheduler[119378]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-f4e96796-0735-453a-bc0a-628b6201f280 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 3.52 sec
Aug 31 21:39:31.867318 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-scheduler[119378]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-f4e96796-0735-453a-bc0a-628b6201f280 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 7.45 sec
Aug 31 21:40:58.464518 ubuntu-focal-ovh-gra1-0026219541 manila-scheduler[119378]: WARNING oslo.service.loopingcall [None req-f4e96796-0735-453a-bc0a-628b6201f280 None None] Function 'manila.service.Service.report_state' run outlasted interval by 5.42 sec"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-09-02 07:34:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

The report interval is 10 seconds - so at times, we're taking longer than 10 seconds to run this routine: https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/0339802a5d0801cda19c464a87853b60982ae011/manila/service.py#L278-L316

We could treat this as a bug to investigate further: https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1942417

As Tom theorized, this warning doesn't seem to be a consequence of haixin's effort to switch from bare looping calls to thread groups - the improved interface is perhaps informing us better of tasks that are taking longer than we expect. So i'll go ahead and merge this, we'll follow up. Thanks haixin!"}]

commit_message:
[Optimise] Use ThredGroup to manage periodic tasks

Instead of manually managing periodic tasks, use
oslo.service's threadgroup.
[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.service/latest/reference/threadgroup.html
[2]:https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/558416

Change-Id: I43a55f0ffff3a0dc6b9fc757869e1e3c3240716f

subject: Bump neutron-lib to 2.13.0

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-08-12 20:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-08-12 20:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-08-31 14:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Something is wrong as I got an error when using 1.38 on the same allocation that can be listed with 1.37

stack@aio:/opt/stack/python-novaclient$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.37 resource provider allocation show 20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403
+--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| resource_provider                    | generation | resources                                   | project_id                       | user_id                          |
+--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| 84845343-37b3-483a-a6e1-d43febc51249 |          6 | {'VCPU': 1, 'MEMORY_MB': 256, 'DISK_GB': 2} | f760c27f2f1c48ae9af66b24466609e9 | 73516320f3cf41d89882f748ca55fae6 |
+--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+

stack@aio:/opt/stack/python-novaclient$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.38 resource provider allocation show 20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403
No such consumer type: None. (HTTP 404)"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Something is wrong as I got an error when using 1.38 on the same allocation that can be listed with 1.37
> 
> stack@aio:/opt/stack/python-novaclient$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.37 resource provider allocation show 20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403
> +--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+
> | resource_provider                    | generation | resources                                   | project_id                       | user_id                          |
> +--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+
> | 84845343-37b3-483a-a6e1-d43febc51249 |          6 | {'VCPU': 1, 'MEMORY_MB': 256, 'DISK_GB': 2} | f760c27f2f1c48ae9af66b24466609e9 | 73516320f3cf41d89882f748ca55fae6 |
> +--------------------------------------+------------+---------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+----------------------------------+
> 
> stack@aio:/opt/stack/python-novaclient$ openstack --os-placement-api-version 1.38 resource provider allocation show 20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403
> No such consumer type: None. (HTTP 404)

Hm, this is not due to the client. The error comes from placement:

REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.121.158/placement/allocations/20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "OpenStack-API-Version: placement 1.38" -H "User-Agent: openstacksdk/0.59.0 keystoneauth1/4.3.1 python-requests/2.26.0 CPython/3.8.10" -H "X-Auth-Token: {SHA256}09cf6023c5b3c5f0d9f0bf2e5a0fa2371b148bc506531ea7a716333967da53c9"
Resetting dropped connection: 192.168.121.158
http://192.168.121.158:80 "GET /placement/allocations/20b7e771-f375-4303-84a6-3c7e1d0c2403 HTTP/1.1" 404 226
RESP: [404] Connection: close Content-Length: 226 Content-Type: application/json Date: Thu, 02 Sep 2021 12:14:50 GMT Server: Apache/2.4.41 (Ubuntu) openstack-api-version: placement 1.38 x-openstack-request-id: req-19222e9a-a31a-49dc-a235-826430dfaae6
RESP BODY: {"errors": [{"status": 404, "title": "Not Found", "detail": "The resource could not be found.\n\n No such consumer type: None.  ", "code": "placement.undefined_code", "request_id": "req-19222e9a-a31a-49dc-a235-826430dfaae6"}]}

This consumer (a VM) was created by nova with older than 1.38 microversion so nova is not provided consumer_types in the request.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-02 14:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Pushed a placement fix for the above problem[1]. With that fix applied locally this client patch seems to work as expected.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/807155'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2021-09-02 14:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-02 14:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 17:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'The MonContext can be complete when not all mons have provided an fsid

When the MonContext becomes incomplete during regular operation from,
for example, the replacement of an existing mon unit due to failure,
Ceph Radosgw shoud be able to continue while the new mon
bootstraps itself into the cluster. By ensuring that the
context can complete with one of the mons not reporting an
FSID, the remaining members of the monitor cluster can
support the continuing functioning of RadosGW.

Closes-Bug: #1938919
Change-Id: I293224f46d06cc427b2d3c8f4ae65366ed06909e
'}]
commit_message:
The MonContext can be complete when not all mons have provided an fsid

When the MonContext becomes incomplete during regular operation from,
for example, the replacement of an existing mon unit due to failure,
Ceph Radosgw shoud be able to continue while the new mon
bootstraps itself into the cluster. By ensuring that the
context can complete with one of the mons not reporting an
FSID, the remaining members of the monitor cluster can
support the continuing functioning of RadosGW.

Closes-Bug: #1938919
Change-Id: I293224f46d06cc427b2d3c8f4ae65366ed06909e

Changes specific to the RBD driver should not be in the Cinder API layer.'}, {'account_id': 33826, 'date': '2021-08-31 15:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2
> 
> Changes specific to the RBD driver should not be in the Cinder API layer.

So is that okay to put the checking latest snapshot to each driver or do you have any better suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 33826, 'date': '2021-08-31 16:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 33826, 'date': '2021-08-31 16:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33826, 'date': '2021-08-31 16:23:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2
> > 
> > Changes specific to the RBD driver should not be in the Cinder API layer.
> 
> So is that okay to put the checking latest snapshot to each driver or do you have any better suggestions?

I've add a function named snapshot_is_latest on each driver to check if it's latest or not and return True for RBD. I don't think it's a good solution maybe create a function named `snapshot_should_be_latest` on each driver would be better and then again check for latest in api.

If you have better suggestions please tell me to implement it.
Thanks."}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2021-08-31 18:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Setting constraints to global rather than upper

The upper constraints of the openstack compatible with our documentation
building tox environment. Switching to more lenient global requirements
should allow us to build docs again, while providing a measure of stability.

Also removed the TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE so the settings don't get overriden.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I67dc6d4cda2049792446f036f6a051b409db0d75

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 03:55:29.000000000', 'message': '[tain-only] post stack creation tsx validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

This is explained in detail in this article [a]

If operators don't want to add the TSX flag to the KernelArgs,
they can always set "ForceNoTsx" to true.

Adding this mandatory validation right after the stacks are
updated is probably the earliest place where we can validate
and fail if necessary. We'd rather fail quickly than too late
as this will provide the best experience for our users.

In addition to this, there's a tripleo-validation [b] in the
work.

This is meant to be train-only for now but we will have to
refactor if (when?) we support FFU from queens to Wallaby+

[a] https://access.redhat.com/solutions/6036141
[b] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/790806

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: I35246fbf74394f6e315973283464085d2aef08b2

commit_message:
[train-only] post stack creation tsx validation

RHEL-8.3 kernel disabled the Intel TSX (Transactional
Synchronization Extensions) feature by default as a preemptive
security measure, but it breaks live migration from RHEL-7.9
(or even RHEL-8.1 or RHEL-8.2) to RHEL-8.3.

Operators are expected to explicitly define the TSX flag in
their KernelArgs for the compute role to prevent live-migration
issues during the upgrade process.

This is explained in detail in this article [a]

If operators don't want to add the TSX flag to the KernelArgs,
they can always set "ForceNoTsx" to true.

Adding this mandatory validation right after the stacks are
updated is probably the earliest place where we can validate
and fail if necessary. We'd rather fail quickly than too late
as this will provide the best experience for our users.

In addition to this, there's a tripleo-validation [b] in the
work.

This is meant to be train-only for now but we will have to
refactor if (when?) we support FFU from queens to Wallaby+

[a] https://access.redhat.com/solutions/6036141
[b] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/790806

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: I35246fbf74394f6e315973283464085d2aef08b2

commit_message:
Enable CephDashboard for scenario001

This change just moves (and enables) the Ceph Dashboard to scenario001
instead of scenario004.

Change-Id: I9a27edadbc3dbced6ae794feac0d043e1e648299
(cherry picked from commit 7fe0d28ad11d5be0955b017bd1a8272f2a6fb8a7)

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> This seems like a fix for a scenario where the information about partner and role is configured, can you add a releasenote for it?

Thanks for the review, Iury.

I don't think a reno is needed: this is not a user visible change really (just a check which will avoid breakage), and, more importantly: the burn-in tests have not been released yet (and there will be a reno about them with the Xena release)."}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-08-23 11:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Check the network burnin roles and partner

The network burnin roles are 'reader' and 'writer'. Raise an error
if the role is not provided or if the role is unknown. Equally,
raise an error if the partner is not provided.

Change-Id: I6259a7b0d15d62e68b1dc27f0cb511f8563c02ce

commit_message:
Role description auto-extraction

The description from metadata can now be extracted and
inserted into docs automatically, provided that it exists.

The module was also slightly cleaned up, as there were
some unused imports.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0f7fb80952dfcd8a3ba92d1d85467481e4900484

commit_message:
Revert "Allow reboot to hard disk following iso ramdisk deploy."

This reverts commit 3bad548ce3d34207aa70fde8342082fe243bee31
based upon the comments on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/801343 which
was the stable/wallaby backport for this change
where Derek points out that the change was redundant and
Dmitry asks if the patch should be reverted.

This change is a partial revert where the documentation
changed in the original commit was actually correct all
along.

Change-Id: I4bc9dbeb334f176b7c8ed4e4b5ec36affc17e9cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-31 13:43:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

Passing newline to the dnsmasq may cause security issues, especially
that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

Closes-Bug: #1939733
Change-Id: Ifeaf258f0b5ea86f25620ac4116d618980a7272e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

Passing newline to the dnsmasq may cause security issues, especially
that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

Closes-Bug: #1939733
Change-Id: Ifeaf258f0b5ea86f25620ac4116d618980a7272e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-20 15:12:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes flacky unit test wih py36

When running TestManilaCharm.test_install() with py36 sometimes
test passes and sometimes throws and error while mocking methods.
Seems to be an async race problem mocking a super method first.

This was solved by avoiding mocking super method first.

Closes-Bug: #1940552
Change-Id: Iac55321599b4866784a0631639a93fc828780647
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes flacky unit test wih py36

When running TestManilaCharm.test_install() with py36 sometimes
test passes and sometimes throws and error while mocking methods.
Seems to be an async race problem mocking a super method first.

This was solved by avoiding mocking super method first.

Closes-Bug: #1940552
Change-Id: Iac55321599b4866784a0631639a93fc828780647

GCC presence is required [1] to build uwsgi package  otherwise it will

commit_message:
Install GCC for source installs

GCC presence is required [1] to build uwsgi package  otherwise it will
fail on processing uwsgiconfig.py
While it's got installe with openstack-hosts this might be an issue
when uwsgi is used as a standalone role

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/blob/2989143935775a21d6e8d30c7166c473bd1f78bd/uwsgiconfig.py#L714-L720

Change-Id: I60baab1f6ebbe9e424ebe41967d65a1dcdec4235

I was about to say that SQLAlchemy URL stringifies exactly as given, but yeah if ConfigParser.set_main_option() is going to resolve % tokens at that point, then yes you have to encode it.

but im not sure about the approach here, because if the URL has any legitimate % chars in it, then you are still producing a bad URL:



    str_url = (
        "mysql+pymysql://nova:pass@192.168.24.3/nova?"
        "read_default_file=%2Fetc%2Fmy.cnf.d%2Fno%25va.cnf"
        "&read_default_group=nova"
    )

    obj_url = url.make_url(str_url)

    print(str(obj_url))

    print(
        urllib.parse.unquote(str(obj_url))
    )

why not just double up the percent signs like the doc says?'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-08-23 21:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-24 13:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

>     print(str(obj_url))
> 
>     print(
>         urllib.parse.unquote(str(obj_url))
>     )
> 
> why not just double up the percent signs like the doc says?

the values in the config file did not have %

they were set like this

connection=mysql+pymysql://nova:Jl6ip4yYTetmtrYWydWwJAcmI@192.168.24.3/nova?read_default_file=/etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf&read_default_group=tripleo

so its not a case of doubling up % in the imput sorce

we need to make sure unencoded config options is passed to config parser in such a way as it works.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2021-08-24 14:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the URL I have above, I present the desired character "%", URL encoded as %25.   When this is URL decoded, you will get an actual "%".  which will then be mis-interpreted by the ConfigParser, no?   i mean, we don't really have "%" / "%25" in URLs so this will probably not become apparent, but the fact remains, if you have a URL with % signs in it, just double them up before sending to ConfigParser, that's how this is documented, where they will be de-doubled when retrieved.   I'm not sure why that approach isn't sufficient.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-24 14:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

When this is URL decoded, you will get an actual "%".  which will then be mis-interpreted by the ConfigParser, no?   i mean, we don't really have "%" / "%25" in URLs so this will probably not become apparent, but the fact remains, if you have a URL with % signs in it, just double them up before sending to ConfigParser, that's how this is documented, where they will be de-doubled when retrieved.   I'm not sure why that approach isn't sufficient.

im just not conviced nova shoudl have to do that.

stephen found this stackover flow post which show that we can just turn off interperlation within config parser. i thikn that likely would be a better approch unless we have a reason to keep it enabled

When this is URL decoded, you will get an actual "%".  which will then be mis-interpreted by the ConfigParser, no?   i mean, we don't really have "%" / "%25" in URLs so this will probably not become apparent, but the fact remains, if you have a URL with % signs in it, just double them up before sending to ConfigParser, that's how this is documented, where they will be de-doubled when retrieved.   I'm not sure why that approach isn't sufficient.
> 
> im just not conviced nova shoudl have to do that.
> 
> stephen found this stackover flow post which show that we can just turn off interperlation within config parser. i thikn that likely would be a better approch unless we have a reason to keep it enabled
> 
> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2537929/is-it-possible-to-temporarily-disable-pythons-string-interpolation/42544238#42544238

IIUC this patch is for the purposes of the ConfigParser that's embedded in the alembic config?   alembic's config does not offer this option right now, so this can't be changed unless you modify the ConfigParser() object associated with the alembic.config.Config object directly.   I'm not sure if you have to replace it with a new one or if you can flip "interpolation" after the fact; the former might also be a little bit intricate if there are already config values present.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-24 14:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

it does but i would have to check lower constraints ectra to seee if we can require 1.7+

what i might do is manually do the %% escaping as you suggest for now and leave a todo to remove that and turn off interpolation when we can require the relevent alembic release as a minium in the future

we dont need to rush to the bleeding edge alembic for this i jsut dont want nova to have to always maintain this sting massaging code. if we know that disabling inperpolation is coming at some point in the future im ok with this as a workaround until then.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-25 01:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

so this is eactuly the issue described in 
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/700#issuecomment-636037036

ill update this with the solution contaied in that comment

urllib.parse.quote_plus("@#$%^&*()").replace("%", "%%") and add a todo to remove this when we can disable interpolation in alembic in the future.

ill update this patch tomorrow to reflect that.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-08-25 14:30:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-23 16:45:54.000000000', 'message': "db: Handle parameters in DB strings

As part of 'nova.db.migration', it is necessary to override the
'sqlalchemy.url' config option used by alembic. We were doing this but
we weren't handling the fact that we could receive encoded URL strings.
This causes issues for the ConfigParser instead used under the hood, as
noted in the alembic docs [1]:

  value – the value. Note that this value is passed to ConfigParser.set,
  which supports variable interpolation using pyformat (e.g.
  %(some_value)s). A raw percent sign not part of an interpolation
  symbol must therefore be escaped, e.g. %%. The given value may refer
  to another value already in the file using the interpolation format.

Resolve the issue by simply decoding the URL encoded string. This is
idempotent when presented with unencoded string and therefore can be
done unconditionally.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/config.html#alembic.config.Config.set_main_option

Change-Id: I74de55107a80af13df348f2bce49415b08028746
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-08-23 18:58:32.000000000', 'message': "db: Handle parameters in DB strings

As part of 'nova.db.migration', it is necessary to override the
'sqlalchemy.url' config option used by alembic. We were doing this but
we weren't handling the fact that we could receive encoded URL strings.
This causes issues for the ConfigParser instead used under the hood, as
noted in the alembic docs [1]:

  value – the value. Note that this value is passed to ConfigParser.set,
  which supports variable interpolation using pyformat (e.g.
  %(some_value)s). A raw percent sign not part of an interpolation
  symbol must therefore be escaped, e.g. %%. The given value may refer
  to another value already in the file using the interpolation format.

Resolve the issue by simply decoding the URL encoded string. This is
idempotent when presented with unencoded string and therefore can be
done unconditionally.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/config.html#alembic.config.Config.set_main_option

Closes-Bug: #1940555
Change-Id: I74de55107a80af13df348f2bce49415b08028746
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-08-25 20:01:29.000000000', 'message': "db: Handle parameters in DB strings

As part of 'nova.db.migration', it is necessary to override the
'sqlalchemy.url' config option used by alembic. We were doing this but
we weren't handling the fact that we could receive encoded URL strings.
This causes issues for the ConfigParser instead used under the hood, as
noted in the alembic docs [1]:

  value – the value. Note that this value is passed to ConfigParser.set,
  which supports variable interpolation using pyformat (e.g.
  %(some_value)s). A raw percent sign not part of an interpolation
  symbol must therefore be escaped, e.g. %%. The given value may refer
  to another value already in the file using the interpolation format.

Resolve the issue by escaping % with %%. The engine.url is always encoded
therefore this can be done unconditionally.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/config.html#alembic.config.Config.set_main_option

Closes-Bug: #1940555
Change-Id: I74de55107a80af13df348f2bce49415b08028746
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
"}, {'created': '2021-08-26 09:59:30.000000000', 'message': "db: Handle parameters in DB strings

commit_message:
db: Handle parameters in DB strings

As part of 'nova.db.migration', it is necessary to override the
'sqlalchemy.url' config option used by alembic. We were doing this but
we weren't handling the fact that we could receive encoded URL strings.
This causes issues for the ConfigParser instead used under the hood, as
noted in the alembic docs [1]:

  value – the value. Note that this value is passed to ConfigParser.set,
  which supports variable interpolation using pyformat (e.g.
  %(some_value)s). A raw percent sign not part of an interpolation
  symbol must therefore be escaped, e.g. %%. The given value may refer
  to another value already in the file using the interpolation format.

Resolve the issue by escaping % with %%. The engine.url is always
encoded therefore this can be done unconditionally.

[1] https://alembic.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/api/config.html#alembic.config.Config.set_main_option

Closes-Bug: #1940555
Change-Id: I74de55107a80af13df348f2bce49415b08028746
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>

commit_message:
Restore libvirtd cgroupfs mount

It was removed in [1] as part of cgroupsv2 cleanup.
However, the testing did not catch the fact that the legacy
cgroups behaviour was actually still breaking despite latest
Docker and setting to use host's cgroups namespace.

[1] 286a03bad20955aa4d3f7009cef5856d328b76f1

Closes-Bug: #1941706
Change-Id: I629bb9e70a3fd6bd1e26b2ca22ffcff5e9e8c731
(cherry picked from commit 34c49b9dbed81c606c958ce95078178db1cc9492)

commit_message:
Fix overcloud introspection data save

The command `kayobe overcloud introspection data save` has been failing
due to lack of OpenStack credentials when running the bifrost dynamic
inventory. Add OS_CLOUD=bifrost.

Story: 2009129
Task: 43059
Change-Id: I4a15578135a48cf282672288f4db24ded65f3b82
(cherry picked from commit 3947997ed24a34f8913bb536a4f48a06058a0da4)

commit_message:
WIP: Resolve issues with various HTTP status codes

There are a number of TODOs in the code base regarding response codes
that need to be updated. Address them in one fell swoop using a new
microversion, 2.88.

WIP because I need to (a) make sure my lower constraints are correct (I
suspect some/all should use 2.0 instead of 2.1), and (b) fix all the
tests and docs. Also, are the comments on aggregates correct??

Change-Id: Ia54cb8b9525d4153cfe657840efdb21aede8df72
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
functional: Use helpers for cross-cell resize

These do things "the right way (TM)", helping us avoid issues like those
seen in change I3ec6cae19b362ac9cc311a979f680cf64db4f458.

We use the opportunity to harden the helpers in question, doing things
like waiting for migration statuses where migrations/resizes are
involved, etc.

Change-Id: I1abc7b3022c08169a5d5197da350adca83c71686
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1904051

commit_message:
WIP: objects: Add type hints

Lots of duplication here with regards to fields, but that's necessary
until o.vo develops some way to do this itself, ideally via a plugin for
mypy.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ia7c045bdea9b08329a721631bf23a7b3b985b3f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 17:59:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use "objects_exist" in PortForwardingPlugin

This is a small optimization in
"PortForwardingPlugin._check_floatingip_request". To check the existence
of any OVO, "objects_exist" is the fastest method.

Closes-Bug: #1942358
Change-Id: I5097dbdda5a17d15152c5a6c1a56f5b5037d1f70
'}]
commit_message:
Use "objects_exist" in PortForwardingPlugin

This is a small optimization in
"PortForwardingPlugin._check_floatingip_request". To check the existence
of any OVO, "objects_exist" is the fastest method.

Closes-Bug: #1942358
Change-Id: I5097dbdda5a17d15152c5a6c1a56f5b5037d1f70

commit_message:
WIP! docs: Rework nova console diagram

Remove references to nova-consoleauth, which is going away. We also
remove the PNG and VSD (Visio) variants of the same and use the SVG
variant in the docs instead.

Change-Id: I632b717a7f857f1a54fef855ab63bc35d687ba4a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-audit: Use cliff instead of homegrown argparse bleh

There are a couple of advantages to this approach, chief among them
being the free docs and alignment with things like openstackclient.
cliff is added to requirements.txt, although it's really been a
dependency for many years now, albeit implicitly.

Change-Id: I2e0f15c1734bc178e4187b2db9fd183fb6e2c66a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-08 23:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-03-09 13:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-09 16:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Thanks for working on this. The policy changes weren't actually the thing that I was getting stuck on. Rather, I was having a hard time figuring out how we determine what hypervisors to show to a project admin. The spec said we should do that "based on aggregate metadata" [1] but I wasn't entirely sure what this means. I just clarified with Sean on IRC though and they meant the metadata described at [2].

In any case, as this is currently implemented, a project admin will be able to see _everything_ in the deployment, which I don't think we want. We should either make this narrower or drop this idea entirely.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/modernize-os-hypervisors-api.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/aggregates.html#tenant-isolation-with-placement'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-09 16:19:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Oh, and we go the filter_tenant_id approach then we probably need a specific unit test since I don't think the generic policy tests will quite cover it? This is akin to returning different fields for 'server show' depending on whether you're an admin or a non-admin, only here it depends on whether you're a system admin or project admin 😅"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-03-09 16:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

good point Stephen.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-02 10:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

The default value for the ``os_compute_api:os-hypervisors:list`` policy,
is changed from System Reader to System Reader or Project Admin``.
This way project admins will be able to list the hypervisor and use that
host info in various operation for example, server creation on specific
host.

probably want some DB methods to replace the Python filtering we're

Part of blueprint modernize-os-hypervisors-api

Co-authored-by: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Change default policy for GET '/os-hypervisors' API

The default value for the ``os_compute_api:os-hypervisors:list`` policy,
is changed from System Reader to System Reader or Project Admin``.
This way project admins will be able to list the hypervisor and use that
host info in various operation for example, server creation on specific
host.

WIP because I'm still not sure this is worth pursuing. If so, we
probably want some DB methods to replace the Python filtering we're
doing: a way to filter on aggregate metadata key using 'like' (i.e.
partial match) and a way to filter compute nodes by host names (plural).

Part of blueprint modernize-os-hypervisors-api

Change-Id: Ieecb5432b51008647571b462826cba302dbb248a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

commit_message:
Parameter to set api policy to limit live migration to role

Adds NovaRestrictLiveMigration boolean parmeter to enable an
api policy to allow live migration only for a specific role
which can be customized using NovaRestrictLiveMigrationRole.
This feature is to prevent the default admin role users to
be able to use live migration on coincidence.
Additional policies specified using NovaApiPolicies get
merged with this polic

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/802251

commit_message:
Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk

postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no.
As it is not known yet if this might have performance impact, we might
want to set NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy to False in the dpdk
environment files.

Related-Bug: #1939028
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388

commit_message:
Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk

postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no.
As it is not known yet if this might have performance impact, we might
want to set NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy to False in the dpdk
environment files.

Related-Bug: #1939028
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1986567

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for telegraf services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for telegraf services.
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

Change-Id: Ieb32efb089ef136c307fa41e55ff817d1a825410

commit_message:
Revert "Disable postcopy for ovn/ovs-dpdk"

This reverts commit ddb8acf321d1a108d4a156ff9db20e8d040025a2.

Reason for revert: 
postcopy gets enabled per default if the it is not a realtime node [1].
To have postcopy to work ovs needs to be started with --mlockall=no. This is now done via [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If8958c414c400026c66187261d8fff439aad6388
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/I670b31a921a163f286a8267b808d6d97cc5a61c1

Change-Id: I3e9fd9c150b06b83b668be2fc01369f9936bc3f8

commit_message:
Remove unused c8s nodesets

The *-centos-8-node nodesets have been already switched to CentOS 8
Stream and the *-centos-8-stream-node nodesets are no longer used.

'}]
commit_message:
Release final python-heatclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-heatclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.3.0..b438314
b438314 Replace oslo_utils.fnmatch with fnmatch

commit_message:
Release final python-cyborgclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-cyborgclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.3.0..d051769
28f9622 Add test case for show arq
686ebac Fix the bug of making device_profile_group_id parameter is optional
ec2a079 Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec
9d5bdc5 Hide the traceback when deleting a non-existent ARQ
83c099d Add checks for showing dp with name
72272fe [ussuri][goal] Update contributor documentation
b5f9486 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
1d6d8e2 Add Python3 xena unit tests
1c0a3b4 Update master for stable/wallaby
2a674e6 bug fix: tox wrongly install client from repo path.
6c93f13 Add doc/requirements
8a9a48a update error url
18610ce Revert "remove py37"

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9d7c76f1889c1b1c639ca6a94ad1c3af47e879e8

commit_message:
Release final python-vitrageclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-vitrageclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.3.0..bc829d3
bc829d3 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
096b484 Follow-up patch for fixing coverage issue
77bcc1b Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
63610f0 Migrate from testr to stestr
e70ec02 Add Python3 xena unit tests
3611f26 Update master for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8740e7dce7ba90565b92bd8b781674cfdb317314

commit_message:
api: Add support for 'hostname' parameter

Add microversion 2.90, which allows allows users to configure the
hostname that will be exposed via the nova metadata service when
creating their instance.

Change-Id: I95047c1689ac14fa73eba48e19dc438988b78aad
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-19 18:28:00.000000000', 'message': 'Overcloud introspection data save broken

The command kayobe overcloud introspection data
save has been failing due to lack of OpenStack
credentials when running the bifrost dynamic

commit_message:
Fix overcloud introspection data save

The command `kayobe overcloud introspection data save` has been failing
due to lack of OpenStack credentials when running the bifrost dynamic
inventory. Add OS_CLOUD=bifrost.

Story: 2009129
Task: 43059
Change-Id: I4a15578135a48cf282672288f4db24ded65f3b82

commit_message:
fix: Fix models & eslint

1. The response of models has been changed from array to map, we should make it compatible with old data

2. Change level to `off` for import/prefer-default-export to remove annoying unnecessary warnings

Change-Id: I6feac90b3db36b2c0929b27bb82dee8536951bb3

commit_message:
Fix: Schema validation for attachment create API

Currently the schema validation for attachment create assumes that
instance UUID will always be present in the request but that is
not the case when glance calls cinder for attachment.
Also there isn't any schema validation for MV3.54 which accepts
attachment mode in the request hence failing requests passing mode.
This patch removes the instance_uuid from required parameters and
adds schema validation for MV3.54.

Also includes a squash to add a releasenote from
Change-Id: I4a6e93ea98cfd4988d38bedca6e5538391c1f74d

Change-Id: I5108fd51effa4d72581654ed450d191a13e0e964
(cherry picked from commit 560318c82e9951464361560e57ce0b67011cce74)

messages: [{'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-01 15:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-01 16:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-09-01 18:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-02 05:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 15:39:42.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure there is a space after debug in virtlogd_wrapper

Otherwise when we set debug on we get the following start of
file:
  #!/bin/bash
  set -xARGS="$@"

This will then lead to the error:
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F + exec /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper: line 2: set: -A: invalid option
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F set: usage: set [-abefhkmnptuvxBCHP] [-o option-name] [--] [arg ...]
2021-08-27T18:22:40.763849194+00:00 stdout F Starting a new child container nova_virtlogd
2021-08-27T18:22:41.016340084+00:00 stdout F c46e5d5a121e11aec40264f3473b37e7edeabf6f9404d49666645252a8db63a3

After this change, with debug always on, we correctly get:
  #!/bin/bash
  set -x
  ARGS="$@"
  NAME=nova_virtlogd

Change-Id: Ic2f376e7bfca1ed3d53994994746995fa8fb2366
(cherry picked from commit 2384b77a5ba9a19469defec3d47c0f105bba1dbb)
'}, {'created': '2021-09-01 16:05:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure there is a space after debug in virtlogd_wrapper

  #!/bin/bash

This will then lead to the error:
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F + exec /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper: line 2: set: -A: invalid option
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F set: usage: set [-abefhkmnptuvxBCHP] [-o option-name] [--] [arg ...]

commit_message:
Make sure there is a space after debug in virtlogd_wrapper

Otherwise when we set debug on we get the following start of
file:
  #!/bin/bash
  set -xARGS="$@"

This will then lead to the error:
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F + exec /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F /usr/local/bin/virtlogd_wrapper: line 2: set: -A: invalid option
2021-08-27T18:22:40.444492949+00:00 stderr F set: usage: set [-abefhkmnptuvxBCHP] [-o option-name] [--] [arg ...]
2021-08-27T18:22:40.763849194+00:00 stdout F Starting a new child container nova_virtlogd

[{'created': '2021-09-01 20:23:20.000000000', 'message': 'Notify more relations when cluster is bootstrapped

Currently mon_relation only calls notify_rbd_mirrors when the cluster is
already bootstrapped which leads to broker requests not being handled
for other relations in some cases.

The change also moves the bootstrap attempt code into a separate
function and adds unit tests for mon_relation to cover different
branches for various inputs.

Closes-Bug: #1942224
Change-Id: Id9b611d128acb7d49a9a9ad9c096b232fefd6c68
'}, {'created': '2021-09-01 20:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Notify more relations when cluster is bootstrapped

Currently mon_relation only calls notify_rbd_mirrors when the cluster is
already bootstrapped which leads to broker requests not being handled
for other relations in some cases.

The change also moves the bootstrap attempt code into a separate
function and adds unit tests for mon_relation to cover different

commit_message:
Notify more relations when cluster is bootstrapped

Currently mon_relation only calls notify_rbd_mirrors when the cluster is
already bootstrapped which leads to broker requests not being handled
for other relations in some cases.

The change also moves the bootstrap attempt code into a separate
function and adds unit tests for mon_relation to cover different
branches for various inputs.

Closes-Bug: #1942224
Change-Id: Id9b611d128acb7d49a9a9ad9c096b232fefd6c68

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-08 14:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce container metrics cardinality

Adds support for passing extra runtime options to cAdvisor.
By default new options disable exporting rarely useful metrics
and labels by cAdvisor. This helps reducing the load on Prometheus
and cAdvisor itself.

Change-Id: I81f3845d6cd03a70a0c8569f8d0ea421027df083
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce container metrics cardinality

Adds support for passing extra runtime options to cAdvisor.
By default new options disable exporting rarely useful metrics
and labels by cAdvisor. This helps reducing the load on Prometheus
and cAdvisor itself.

Change-Id: I81f3845d6cd03a70a0c8569f8d0ea421027df083

commit_message:
Make ansible-test sanity voting

- symlink sanity ignore files
- exclude tests/unit from collection as they were causing multiple
  violations on sanity
- remove README.rst from collections as they can only have the README.md
- make sanity job voting to prevent regressions

Change-Id: Ifad87a22bec86734e9db4270f4de368ca91b1f67

(1 comment)

Thanks for the detailed info. Here goes a couple of suggestions:

Regarding the diagram of reconciliation flow, perhaps the arrow is pointing to the wrong direction Neutron -> Kuryr-COntroller. Kuryr would call Neutron API looking for status of the Openstack resources. BTW, perhaps the diagram should contain the Octavia API as well instead of only Neutron as Octavia is the that handle load balancers, and we could make it generic to any kind of openstack resource. Also the sync_lbaas_members method is the one syncing openstack resources so it calls the drivers to call the octivia api not k8s api.'}, {'account_id': 33240, 'date': '2021-06-23 22:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 33240, 'date': '2021-06-24 10:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 33240, 'date': '2021-06-24 12:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2021-06-25 12:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

Sure I noticed after the implementation. Re-working...'}, {'account_id': 33240, 'date': '2021-07-27 11:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-08-02 08:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

Just few things needs to be rechecked:

- maybe the lb = load_loadbalancers() could be renamed, as that name is not really descriptive about which osp action was triggered
- the get_kuryrloadbalancer_crds is actually calling the k8s API not the drivers
- patch lb status should come after the ensure_lb
- there seems to be some rendering issue
- there is no need for the arrow of definition of selflink, instead you can add the condition to the following arrow actually making the lbaas_reconcile call'}, {'account_id': 33240, 'date': '2021-08-03 10:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2021-08-06 06:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

Couple of comments mentioned on patchset 17 were missed'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2021-09-02 07:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

I think the png figure is not correct, why the loadbalancer tagging appears there? Similarly for the k8s get clients. The important thing there is that you get the loadbalancer CRDs and check the OpenStack loadbalancer IDs on the CRDs status are still present on the OpenStack side. And for the ones that are not, the reconciliation is triggered (by patching the status)'}]

commit_message:
Kuryr Kubernetes Loadbalancers Reconciliation Design

The purpose of this document is to define the design decision behind
the OpenStack resources reconciliation. A ServiceReconciliationHandler
is added to the Kuryr Controller pipeline which manages the OpenStack
service events.

Change-Id: Ib28708fa726137469913f1b83e679a905490b218

Thanks for the patch. Unfortunately, I'm finding it rather confusing. Is there a reason this is proposed against stable/train rather than master? The standard practice is to fix on master and then backport as far as you need. Perhaps this is a thing that only affects Python 2.7? If so, you need to provide this additional context in the commit message. You should also tag the commit message with StableOnly or similar to show why you have done things the way you have. If not, this needs to be moved to master and merged before we start backporting it the various stable branches."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-08-11 09:16:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If not, this needs to be moved to master and merged before we start backporting it the various stable branches.

commit_message:
Catch ConnectionForced Exception

Occasionally I saw large number of connectionforced exceptions.
such exceptions cannot be healed automatically and requires a reboot.
catch it and ensure connection established.

Change-Id: I97287e81b1ea6a910e2543eea79c0d78e51743d6
Closes-Bug: #1883038

[{'created': '2021-08-31 15:26:44.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix list of mandatory services for CIFS share creation

To create a CIFS share, it is mandatory to configure an active
directory service, but the code was requiring to configure also
the `ldap` and `kerberos` services to be configured during the
creation of a CIFS share.

This patch fixes this, removing `ldap` and `kerberos` from the
list of mandatory security services.

Change-Id: I34020da6a929f5c7ae1c63bc0f2ef338c49dbe10
Closes-bug: #1942124
'}, {'created': '2021-08-31 15:30:44.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix list of mandatory services for CIFS share creation

To create a CIFS share, it is mandatory to configure an active
directory service, but the code was requiring to configure also
the `ldap` and `kerberos` services to be configured during the
creation of a CIFS share.

This patch fixes this, removing `ldap` and `kerberos` from the
list of mandatory security services.

Change-Id: I34020da6a929f5c7ae1c63bc0f2ef338c49dbe10
Closes-bug: #1942124
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix list of mandatory services for CIFS share creation

To create a CIFS share, it is mandatory to configure an active
directory service, but the code was requiring to configure also
the `ldap` and `kerberos` services to be configured during the
creation of a CIFS share.

This patch fixes this, removing `ldap` and `kerberos` from the
list of mandatory security services.

Change-Id: I34020da6a929f5c7ae1c63bc0f2ef338c49dbe10
Closes-bug: #1942124

[{'created': '2021-08-11 09:44:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

commit_message:
Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

Since PyYAML 5.1, yaml.load without specifying the Loader option is
deprecated and shows the following warning.

YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.

This change replaces usage of yaml.load by yaml.safe_load, to get rid
of that warning message.

Change-Id: Ibe25c4aaf3aa7226f28ec60b8a929ecc143face1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 14:26:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix neutron_pg_drop-related startup issues

There is a python-ovs bug that allows transactions to be executed
before it has started monitoring the db for changes. This breaks
ovsdbapp's AddCommand behavior, which looks up a row in memory
post-commit to return it to the caller, because we process the
reply from ovsdb-server that has the UUID in it, but when we try to
look it up in memory, it isn't there since that is handled via the
monitor notifications.

Since we don't care about the return value, we can just ignore the
KeyError. In addition, the request to Idl.cond_change() to monitor
only the neutron_pg_drop table was failing for a similar reason--
it is called before the initial monitor request is sent, so
directly setting table.condition will allow the condition to be
added to the initial monitor request.

Closes-Bug: #1938766
Change-Id: I78af15970a86923fb810e903d38634b6e60a8fe4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron_pg_drop-related startup issues

There is a python-ovs bug that allows transactions to be executed
before it has started monitoring the db for changes. This breaks
ovsdbapp's AddCommand behavior, which looks up a row in memory
post-commit to return it to the caller, because we process the
reply from ovsdb-server that has the UUID in it, but when we try to
look it up in memory, it isn't there since that is handled via the
monitor notifications.

Since we don't care about the return value, we can just ignore the
KeyError. In addition, the request to Idl.cond_change() to monitor
only the neutron_pg_drop table was failing for a similar reason--
it is called before the initial monitor request is sent, so
directly setting table.condition will allow the condition to be
added to the initial monitor request.

Closes-Bug: #1938766

Hi, this is effort for early goal survey, which you can provide/find more information on https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/support-tls-default 
Feel free to update this patch and work on this. Please help to provide information if you think this makes no sense to this project.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-17 12:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This makes sense and appears to work, so OK by me.  From the commit message on Sean's patch turning it off (change I4b17ac2f58b695), it was only disabled because there wasn't any reason to use it for the single test this job currently runs.  But now we have a reason, so let's use it.

While looking at the Zuul results, I noticed that the functional-py36 tests reported success even though no tests were run (couldn't find a py36 interpreter).  I'll address that in a different patch."}, {'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2021-06-30 09:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-07-16 14:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I380a139a684b5f8cd23958323ef2c40af9708d29
